sub_title: Product guy, creative enthusiast, fullstack designer & developer.
summary:
I am a designer with a strong interest in digital product development. Over the years, I've grown into a multi-faceted professional, combining my design expertise with technical skills.

My approach focuses on translating complex technical solutions into delightful user experiences. I specialise in rapid prototyping and product testing by using (event-based) data to inform decision-making and drive product innovation. My aim is to create solutions that cater to end-users and contribute to the success of the companies I collaborate with.

My skill set includes experience with various technologies, such as artificial intelligence, event-driven architectures, process mining, knowledge graphs, linked data (RDF/OWL), and many other web technology standards. I love working within diverse teams, where I can blend design principles with technical know-how to collaborate energetically and effectively.

Looking for a professional that can navigate the intersection of design and technology? Let’s connect and explore innovative solutions to meet your challenges.

education.field_of_study: Industrieel ontwerpen (Industrial design) / Industrieel product ontwerpen
Industrieel ontwerpen (Industrial design) / Industrieel product ontwerpen

projects.title: Datascaping
projects.description: Datascaping is about the use of data as a material in the design process. Datascaping revolves around proto-products, seamingly finished prototypes that collect data. This data is used as inspiration for iterations of proto products. These iterations are done on both a firmware and physical level. Datascaping enables designer to design personalized (IoT) products that grow into meaning and value for a market.

contributors.headline: Product guy, creative enthusiast, fullstack designer & developer.

projects.title: Algoloom
projects.description:
Algoloom’s are unique visuals printed on canvasses. They are procedurally generated based on two personal images. They can be made to match an interior or to carry a hidden personal message.

Algoloom was exhibited at TAC during the Dutch Design Week of 2014.

contributors.headline: Product guy, creative enthusiast, fullstack designer & developer.
Digitaal strateeg & Frontend developer at Freshheads

projects.title: Hirocon
projects.description:
Hirocon is a pendant that is procedurally generated based on a personal text that is written by its user. The pendant is a physical representation of a personal unique story and serves as a catalyst for a user to remember that story. Hirocon pendants are designed to have small differences in form giving, but maintain an overall form-family to emphasize the feeling of belonging to a group or community.

The pendant was designed to address the uniqueness of individuals, to create awareness of one’s self and others as unique individuals and to unite these individuals in a group or community. New production technologies (like laser cutting and water cutting) and Generative Design are used to design a product which connects people through buying the same product, while maintaining personal and unique features to address the uniqueness of individual human beings.

contributors.headline: Product guy, creative enthusiast, fullstack designer & developer.

projects.title: Waves at GLOW NEXT
projects.description:
WAVES
 
See your own soundwaves
 

Light and sound are two types of waves. Like radio and the waves that our cell phones make to communicate with each other. We are continuously surrounded by waves, but we never see them.

Until now! Because here, at the cradle of radio and television, sound waves are being visualized. Whistle, clap, talk, sing or scream and see the waves you produce yourself. Experience how waves travel through space and bounce off the walls. Discover how different tones also produce different waves.

WAVES is a world premiere. The project is based on the sound imaging technology of Sorama, which is commercially available in the brand new 1024 microphone Sorama Cam. WAVES is a joint effort of a team of 9 students of OPENLIGHT: the creative lab of the Intelligent Lighting Institute of the TU Eindhoven, and a team of 15 sound experts and software developers of Sorama, a spin-off of the TU/e that is located at Strijp-S. The result is a unprecedented interactive lighting visualization.

This 6-week project I performed as part of the student team from OPENLIGHT at the TU/e. We were responsible for the conceptual development of this installation, as well as the design of the visual appearance, experience and the first version of the visualisation code used. 

The installation was originally developed for the light spectacle 'GLOW-Next' in Eindhoven, but has since then been at multiple events among which the Dutch Design Week 2014 as part of the exhibition 'Mind the Step'.

projects.title: Quasar
projects.description: Quasar is an online platform for music enthusiasts in the world of streaming. Quasar uses music listening history, location and activity data so that users can generate playlists in Spotify. These playlists enable users to re-experience any musical moment they have ever had, discover new music or share their musical identity.

contributors.headline: Product guy, creative enthusiast, fullstack designer & developer.

profile_positions.description: I help customers improve their businesses by building modern high-quality digital solutions. I specialise in rapidly developing POC's for data heavy web applications and visualisations. With a broad hands-on knowledge of design, marketing, business and technology I translate complex technical challenges into delightful user experiences.
profile_positions.title: Fullstack Designer & Developer

profile_positions.description:
End responsible and manager of product development at MedApp. Funneling community feedback, feature requests, business requirements and ideas & concepts into new features for MedApp. Translating and communicating the desired user experience using design sketches and clear requirements for IT Development.

I also did (performance) marketing at MedApp, designing advertisements, placing and managing them using Google Adwords and Facebook Analytics. I regurarly assisted in designing visuals and supplied feedback for the businesses' pitch deck and strategy.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description: End responsibility for user experience over the entire range of products concerning MedApp. I also designed and management advertisements in Google Adwords and Facebook ads and assisted sales and business intelligence.
profile_positions.title: UX Designer

profile_positions.description:
In collaboration with three other freelance designers we started an initiative called Cindle. Cindle identified fruitful IoT solutions that could empower our customers' businesses through rapid prototyping.

We built 'protoproducts' (or high-quality prototypes) and deployed them in the real world to quickly collect data and generate insights for our customers. 

Most of our customers' employees were new to IoT so we gave hands-on workshops and brainstorms to educate them about the subject. We believe educating a company's employees is a crucial part of sustainable innovation as most work surrounding IoT requires companies to change processes and perspectives internally. 

Within Cindle my primary responsibilities were managing our internal collaborations, communication with customers, presenting and pitching, managing and planning projects and programming the IoT infrastructure for projects.
profile_positions.title: Designer & IoT Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Using Momics as a working title for freelance work, I offered support and advice in the field of data enabled design to students and other stakeholders in the SQUAD Data Enabled Design at the Technical University of Eindhoven.

As SQUAD support I was able to enjoy an enjoyable interplay and exchange of knowledge around data driven design. I could share knowledge of my final master project and freelance work with new students and the students could show me new insights and thoughts in the field.
profile_positions.title: Freelance SQUAD Support

profile_positions.description:
Momics started as a small company designing and developing DIY robotics for technology promotion. The robots were sold in workshops on several festivals and events such as the Dutch Design Week, RoboCup, TU/e promotional events, STRP School and the Discovery festival.

As independent founder I was responsible for the whole process from idea to product for the Momics DIY kit. Including promotion and sales of the kits and organizing and giving workshops at events.
profile_positions.title: Founder Momics DIY Robotics
